cheatsheet.title: Create a new Web Service from Relational Views/Sources

intro.description:
This cheat sheet will guide you through the steps required to create and optionally deploy a Web service starting with one or more Relational Views or Sources.
Note: These steps are sequential and require you to complete or skip each step before being allowed to Perform, Complete or Skip the next step.
To learn more about using cheat sheets click the help icon above.
Press "Click to Begin" button below to start.

item.title: Create a Model Project
item.description:
First, you will need to create a Model Project. This is where all the models are stored on your local computer. The location is defined by the "workspace" location you defined at start-up.
==========================================================================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to create new VDB.
-- > You may skip this step if you have already imported this data.
==========================================================================================================

item.title: Import from Relational Data Sources
item.description:
Next, you will need to obtain the structure of the database tables and procedures of interest. This will create a Source Model of your data
==========================================================================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below import source data.
-- > Repeat as as needed to obtain all desired source data.
-- > Press "Click to Complete" button below when finished.
-- > You may skip this step if you have already imported this data.
==========================================================================================================

item.title: Test Relational Sources
item.description:
A VDB is testable if sources are defined, all sources have valid connector bindings, no validation errors exist and a "green" status is displayed in the Web Service Advisor.
==========================================================================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to execute the VDB.
-- > Repeat as as needed to verify expected results.
-- > Press "Click to Complete" button below when finished.
-- > You may skip this step.
==========================================================================================================
Note - VDB and its models must be free of errors.
==========================================================================================================

item.title: Create Web Service Models
item.description:
Now you are ready to create your Web service model directly from your source models.
This step creates the following:
-- 1) XML View model of your sources which converts relational data into XML format.
-- 2) Input and output XML Schema models which define the xml structures for your Web service documents.
-- 3) A Web service model containing the interfaces and operations mapped to the XML View model output documents.
==========================================================================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to launch wizard.
-- > Fill in all required fields and press "Finish" to generate Web services.
-- > Repeat as as needed to generate desired Web services.
-- > Press "Click to Complete" button below when finished.
-- > You may skip this step if you have already created Web service models.
==========================================================================================================
Note 1 - You may skip this step if you have already created Web service models.
Note 2 - In order to successfully complete this step, primary keys or access patterns must be available for each table, and each procedure must have at least one IN or IN - OUT parameter.
==========================================================================================================

item.title: Test XML View
item.description:
Once your VDB is complete you can test it. A VDB is complete when all views have been mapped to sources, all sources have valid connector bindings, no validation errors exist and a "green" status is displayed in the Web Service Advisor.
==========================================================================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to execute the VDB.
-- > Repeat as as needed to verify expected results.
-- > Press "Click to Complete" button below when finished.
-- > You may skip this step.
==========================================================================================================
Note - VDB and its models must be free of errors.
==========================================================================================================

item.title: Create Web Service WAR File
item.description:
You can now create a WAR file to deploy to a Servlet container with the Web services defined.
==========================================================================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to create the WAR file
-- > In the dialog, specify WAR file location on your file system, set properties, view connector bindings information and finish by clicking "OK".
==========================================================================================================
Note - VDB and its models must be free of errors.
==========================================================================================================

item.title: Summary
item.description:
The Web service has been created and is ready to deploy. Here is a summary of the steps we have taken:
1. You created a VDB that holds all the models and configuration.
2. You created a Relational Source Model via Import representing the structure of the database tables and procedures.
3. You used the Create Web Service wizard to generate all remaining models needed for the Web service.
4. You created a WAR file that contains all your work and is ready to deploy to a Servlet Container.
Select "Click to Complete" button below to go back to the beginning of this cheat sheet.
